name: Amazon Eco Park Jungle Lodge

reviews.text: The Amazon eco lodge is close to Manaus but you wouldn't know it until you leave the lodge to take the trip to the meeting of the waters. We did the three day package and enjoyed all of the planned activities in the company of our excellent guide, Yury, and opportunities to relax in the natural swimming pools.
reviews.title: Breakfast with the birds

likes.liked: — location - quiet but close to airport
likes.disliked: — outside of the resort we thought the amazon overly tourist oriented

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't expect to be able to wander off into the jungle on your own as there are no marked paths.
reviews.title: You will not get a room in the jungle, you will get the jungle in the room
Different holiday experience
reviews.text: Jungle walk, caiman spotting at night, piranha fishing and a visit to the monkey sanctuary are all close to the lodge. They were very open about the local village experience having been created for tourists, claiming it was a chance for us to experience how people lived deeper in the jungle.

reviews.title: I always stay here when I am in the Amazon Rain forest
reviews.text: I'd rate accomodation as three star jungle experience. Small, basic, rustic rooms, not a lot of light, but comfortable and clean. Ours smelled a bit damp but the only wildlife we encountered was a tiny frog in the shower. The restaurant was fine - you share it with resident macau and parrots. There is a small bar near reception. Beer and caiparhinas are reasonably priced but don't order wine. The most expensive glass of wine we encountered throughout our trip, and not particularly good.

aka: Amazon Eco Park Jungle Hotel Amazon River
